title: What is the best complete music album? - Quora

response.answer_text: Daylight Again, by Crosby, Stills, and Nash The Book of Secrets, by Loreena McKennitt Watermark, by Enya The Celts, by Enya O Come All Ye Faithful, by Kings College Choir (of Cambridge, UK), conducted by Stephen Cleobury, with David Willcocks on pipe organ (on the Argo label in the US, or possibly on Decca or London in the UK) Faure and Durufle Requiems, performed by the Atlanta Symphony Orchestra and Chorus, conducted by Robert Shaw (on Telarc) John Rutter Requiem (and a few other songs), performed by the Turtle Creek Chorale and the Dallas Women’s Choir, conducted by Timothy Seelig (on Reference Recordings) Organ Fireworks, performed by Christopher Herrick on the great organ at Westminster Abbey (on Hyperion) Stravinsky’s Rite of Spring, performed by the Cleveland Orchestra, conducted by Lorin Maazel (on Telarc) Mussorgsky’s Pictures at an Exhibition, performed by the Cleveland Orchestra, conducted by Lorin Maazel (on Telarc) Mahler’s Symphony #1 (“Titan”), performed by the New York Philharmonic, conducted by Zubin Mehta (on CBS Masterworks) Rimsky-Korsakov’s Scheherezade, performed by the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Fritz Reiner (on RCA Victor) Joseph Jongen’s Symphonie Concertante, performed by the San Francisco Symphony, conducted by Edo de Waart, with Michael Murray on the Ruffatti pipe organ in Davies Symphony Hall (inaugural recording of this organ, on Telarc) (and numerous other complete CD albums which are basically a single symphony performance by one of the great orchestras of the world, conducted by one of the great conductors of the world) And finally — on my wish list — this CD album doesn’t exist yet, but I really wish that this performance could be released on CD: Aaron Copland’s Third Symphony, performed by the San Francisco Symphony, conducted by Michael Tilson Thomas (in the summer of year 2000, and also in the spring of year 2003). This is the most amazing interpretation and performance that I’ve ever heard for this symphony. No other performance, even that of Leonard Bernstein conducting the New York Philharmonic, even comes close to the “magic” that MTT/SFS put into their performance. Why, oh why, do they keep sitting on this recording (in the private archives of the San Francisco Symphony)? If only they could release it on CD — this is a performance that, in my opinion, deserves a Grammy Award. Seriously!

Multiples, some of the best IMHO of “complete” albums…. The Blessing - Locust & Wild Honey… I admit lol that I bought this CD at a used music store solely due to the album cover, thinking “damn this is cool!” However, once I started playing it… pure wonderfulness emitted from the speakers. And I cannot get enough of this album, or anything else that William Topley has created.Pink Floyd - Animals, DSotM, and The Wall… others have stated their opinions about these masterpieces… all I can state here is that from start to finish, each of these three IMHO are fully “complete”. Sheer genius masterpieces are what these musicians were able to create.Heavy Metal - the soundtrack… kick some interstellar arse, with some of the best R’nR tunes, that all flow together to paint a awesome journey through time and space.Ancestral Voices - R. Carlos Nakai & Willam Eaton… a peaceful, serene, beautiful, haunting, sensual, uplifting, and relaxing walk through the mazes of Nature, each song building upon and continuing the journey of the previous.Tunnel of Love - Bruce Springsteen… a blending of pain and heartbreak and hope and desire, this album captures the spirit of love and relationships.Heart Shaped World - Chris Isaak… another gem, from start to finish, with emotional lyrics and raw-to-silky voice and wonderful music.Alchemy: Live - Dire Straits… a romp in Paris by this talented group led by the magician Mark Knopfler, a damn good dynamic album every song.Chicago Must Be Crazy - Melissa Etheridge… a bootleg album, damn what a ride this friggin talented and beautiful lady provides via her energy, captured so well here [and lol the cover photo is great too! :) ]Le Roi Est Mort, Vive Le Roi! - Enigma… a journey into space, dreams, and time.Dreamboat Annie - Heart… an album filled with warmth, beauty, awesome guitar, melting vocals, and a wondrous mix of ballads and rock ‘n roll.2112, Hemispheres, and A Farewell to Kings - Rush… each of these albums IMHO are so damn “complete”, in and of themselves. What three guys from Canada are able to create here,,, amazing. Simply awesome music, from beginning to end of each.
